attributes.action: Campaign for the Living Wage in Care
attributes.additional_details:
The Campaign for the Living Wage in Care wants all direct care workers in the health and social care sector to be paid the living wage.
The level of commitment, training and responsibility would, in any other sector, be considered a professional role. Care workers are amongst the lowest paid and under-valued employees in the country.
Their crucial job demands the living wage to generate incentive; promote the best care practice and drive up the quality of employees caring for the most vulnerable in our society.
We want the government to introduce legislation ensuring that all staff delivering direct care in the United Kingdom are paid at least the living wage.

rejection.details: See 'Pay Carers a living Wage' and 'minimum wage for carers'
